title: Metallica - The Vault (Live London 1986) 256ak
description:
Metallica - The Vault 1986 256ak

Metallica front man Lars Ulrich read his testimony before the Senate Judiciary Committee on July 11th, 2000,  Metallica discovered that their song, â€œI Disappear,â€ which was on the â€˜Mission: Impossible IIâ€™ soundtrack, was being played on the radio. He said that the source of the leak was a file on Napsterâ€™s file-sharing network. It was  revealed that the bandâ€™s entire catalogue was available, which led Metallica to argue that Napster was enabling users to exchange copyrighted MP3 files. The group went after a minimum of $10 million in damages, at a rate of $100,000 per song that was downloaded.  Metallica hired NetPD, to monitor Napster. They made a list of 335,435 Napster users who were sharing the bandâ€™s songs online . Metallica demanded that all of their songs be banned from file sharing, and that the users sharing their music be banned,resulting in over 300,000 users being banned. Which was a epic fail because users rejoined under a different name. 

A blast from the past huh? Yep, good ol' Metallica the lynchpin for censorship and file deletion from those who only wanted to share. 
How little we knew then, how big and far reaching this actually would be.

But Im not here to preach just to remind and share......

Tracklist:  Live "Hammersmith Odeon" Theatre London UK September 21st 1986

01. Master of Puppets.mp3
02. For Whom The Bell Tolls.mp3
03. Welcome Home Sanitarium.mp3
04. Ride the Lightning.mp3
05. Cliff Solo.mp3
06. Whiplash.mp3
07. The Thing That Should Not Be.mp3
08. Fade to Black.mp3
09. Seek and Destroy.mp3
10. Creeping Death.mp3
11. The Four Horsemen.mp3
12. Kirk Solo.mp3
13. Damage Inc.mp3
14. Fight Fire with Fire.mp3

Roadie John Marshall, who played guitar in "Metal Church", filled in for James Hetfield on rhythm guitar  September 21 following Hetfield's  skateboarding accident which resulted in a broken arm.
